summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to their team, requesting the marking of specific financial exhibits from JP Morgan subpoena returns for the Epstein case. The exhibits include account applications, statements, and wire transfer records related to the Financial Trust Company.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, requesting the marking of financial exhibits from JP Morgan subpoena returns for the case.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors are marking financial exhibits from JP Morgan subpoena returns, indicating an active financial investigation.
Exhibits include a Financial Trust Company account application (JPM-SDNY-00001937), 1999 account statements (JPM-SDNY-00036863 through 00036869), and a 2002 wire transfer record (JPM-SDNY-00005512).
The email mentions an additional financial transaction from 2007 that is under discussion for potential inclusion.
The correspondence is dated September 29, 2021, showing the investigation was active at that time.
The communication originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
